attributes.short_header: Beginning on Mon, May 1, 2017, access to the east entrance of N Station will be through a covered walkway
attributes.header: Beginning on Monday, May 1, 2017, access to the east entrance of North Station will be through a covered walkway. Legends way will be closed to pedestrian access.
attributes.description: Customers are advised that on Monday, May 1, 2017, the pedestrian route for customers transferring from the Green and Orange Line exits at Causeway and Beverly St into North Station Commuter Rail will be moved slightly to accommodate ongoing construction work. After crossing Causeway St, pedestrians will use a protected walkway along the east side of Legends Way, directly abutting Portal Park. The walkway will include a barrier and kick-plate for blind and low vision passengers.

attributes.short_header: Elevator 804 PARK STREET - Tremont Street to the Lobby will be reconstructed and will be out of service through June 2017.
attributes.header: Elevator 804 PARK STREET - Tremont Street to the Lobby will be reconstructed and will be out of service through June 2017.
attributes.description: If entering the station, cross Tremont Street to the Boston Common and use Park Street Elevator 978 to the Green Line westbound platform. Red Line platform access is available via the elevator beyond the fare gates. If exiting the station, please travel down the Winter Street Concourse toward Downtown Crossing Station, exit through the fare gates, and take Downtown Crossing Elevator 892 to the street level.

attributes.short_header: Buses will replace Red Line between Braintree & Quincy Adams Stations and JFK/UMass & Ashmont Stations on the weekend of Jun 10-11, all day
attributes.header: Buses will replace Red Line service between Braintree & Quincy Adams Stations and JFK/UMass & Ashmont Stations on the weekend of June 10-11, from start to end of service.
attributes.description:
Due to the Winter Resiliency Improvement Program, buses will replace Red Line Braintree branch service between Braintree and Quincy Adams and Ashmont branch service between Ashmont and JFK/UMass in both directions from start to end of service on the following dates:

- Saturday, June 10, 2017 and Sunday, June 11, 2017 

Regular Red Line train service will resume at the start of service on Monday, June 12.
All shuttle bus stops are accessible for persons with disabilities. 

Shuttling the following Braintree branch stops:
Quincy Adams (busway)
Braintree (busway)

Shuttling the following Ashmont branch stops:
JFK/Umass (busway) 
Savin Hill (Connect to shuttle bus service at Dorchester Ave @ Savin Hill Ave) 
Fields Corner (busway) 
Shawmut (Connect to shuttle bus service at Dorchester Ave @ Centre St) 
Ashmont (busway)

attributes.short_header: Routes 8 & 16: All trips may depart the UMass Campus Center earlier than scheduled due to construction.
attributes.header: Routes 8 & 16: All trips may depart the UMass Campus Center earlier than scheduled due to construction.
attributes.description: Due to upcoming construction in front of the Campus Center, Route 8 and 16 buses may depart the Campus Center earlier than the published schedule and will not idle. For alternate MBTA service, please use the existing stop near campus, on Mt. Vernon Street by Harbor Point. Buses will depart from Mount Vernon Street at/near scheduled "Leave UMass" department times.

attributes.short_header: Due to the Simon Company's Copley Place construction, Back Bay Stations Dartmouth Street underpass will remain closed until June 1, 2017.
attributes.header: Due to the Simon Company's Copley Place construction, Back Bay Stations Dartmouth Street underpass will remain closed until June 1, 2017.
attributes.description:
Due to Copley Place construction being performed by the Simon Company, the Dartmouth Street underpass  leading to and from the west side of Dartmouth Street at Back Bay Station will be temporarily closed until June 1.
Customers are encouraged to use the stations main entrance on the east side of Dartmouth Street during the underpass closure. 

Affected routes:
Orange Line
Framingham/Worcester Line
Needham Line
Franklin Line
Providence/Stoughton Line

attributes.header: Elevator 922 CHINATOWN - Forest Hills Platform to Boylston & Washington Sts will remain out of service until further notice.
attributes.description: If exiting, exit the train at Tufts Medical Center and switch to an Oak Grove-bound train. Exit at Chinatown using Chinatown Elevator 876. If boarding, take the Silver Line to Tufts Medical Center. Alternatively, if you are able, follow Washington Street for one-quarter of a mile to Downtown Crossing Elevator 892 (corner of Winter and Washington Streets).

attributes.header: Elevator 941 NORTH STATION - Lobby to the Commuter Rail and Boston Garden will remain closed until further notice due to construction of the Boston Garden Development.
attributes.description: If exiting, return to the fare lobby to use North Station Elevator 912 (lobby to Causeway Street) or pass through the fare gates, walk the full length of the Green Line platform to use North Station Elevator 909 (lobby to Valenti Way). If boarding, cross Causeway Street to use North Station Elevator 912 (lobby to street) or travel one-tenth of a mile down Haverhill Street to the entrance located at the intersection of Haverhill Street and Valenti Way.

attributes.short_header: Due to rail tie replacement on the Worcester Line btwn Wellesley Farms & Westboro, mid-day trains Mon-Fri may experience delays of 5-15 min
attributes.header: Due to the necessary replacement of railroad ties on the Worcester Line between Wellesley Farms & Westborough, weekday Worcester Line trains may experience delays of 5-15 minutes in both directions between 8:30 am and 4:00 pm.
attributes.description: Additionally, peak hour trains may see minor delays due to speed restrictions around construction zones.  Replacement of railroad ties is expected to be completed by the first week of June.

attributes.description:

Any vehicles remaining in the lot after 6:00 pm on Thursday, June 22, will be towed.

attributes.short_header: Please board all trains on the inbound platforms at Haverhill & Bradford except Trains 216 & 222
attributes.header: Please board all trains on the inbound platforms at Haverhill and Bradford except Trains 216 (1:35 pm from Haverhill) and 222 (6:09 pm from Haverhill).
attributes.description:
Due to the Merrimack River Bridge project, trains that operate between Bradford and Haverhill will only use the inbound track. Trains that are bused between Haverhill and Bradford will board on the outbound platform at Bradford for service into Boston. Note: Train 216 (1:35 pm from Haverhill) and Train 222 (6:09 pm from Haverhill) are bused from Haverhill Station to Bradford Station. The outbound platform at Bradford may be accessed via the crossing that is south (to the right when facing the tracks from the parking lot) of the mini-high platforms. Alternatively, the outbound platform can also be accessed via the sidewalk from Laurel Avenue.


Affected stops:
Bradford
Haverhill

attributes.short_header: Spring 2017 Commuter Rail schedules are now in effect as of Mon, May 22nd. Paper schedules are available at S Station, Back Bay, & N Station
attributes.header: Spring 2017 Commuter Rail schedules are now in effect as of Monday, May 22nd. Paper schedules are available at South Station, Back Bay, and North Station.
attributes.description:
Schedules are also available online at mbta.com.

Schedule changes have been made to the Newburyport/Rockport, Haverhill, Fitchburg, Providence/Stoughton, and Worcester lines.
The Worcester Line schedule includes service to the new Boston Landing Station.
There are no schedule changes on the Lowell, Needham, Franklin, Fairmount, Middleboro/Lakeville, Kingston/Plymouth, or Greenbush lines. These schedules are only being re-printed without severe weather train designations.

attributes.short_header: Shuttle buses replacing Orange Line service between Wellington and Oak Grove Stations on June 3 - 4 from start to end of service.
attributes.header: Shuttle buses replacing Orange Line service between Wellington and Oak Grove Stations on June 3 - 4 from start to end of service.
attributes.description:
Due to the MassDOT Woods Memorial Bridge Project, buses will replace Orange Line service in both directions between Wellington and Oak Grove Stations from start to end of service on Saturday, June 3, 2017 and Sunday, June 4, 2017.

Regular Orange Line train service will resume at the start of service on Monday, June 5, 2017.

All shuttle bus stops are accessible for persons with disabilities.

Shuttling the following stops:
Oak Grove
Malden Center
Wellington

attributes.short_header: Prov. side pedestrian bridge work at Canton Jct. is experiencing unexpected construction delays. Visit mbta.com/alerts for more info.
attributes.header: The Providence side of the pedestrian bridge at Canton Junction is closed for repairs, requiring a 10-15 minute detour around the station to access other platforms.
attributes.description:
The pedestrian bridge work is experiencing unexpected construction delays.  The Engineering team is actively working to resolve these issues, and a new update will be posted as soon as possible.

During construction, the station will remain fully accessible and mini-high platforms will remain open. 

Access between Platform A (Providence outbound) and B/C/D (Providence inbound/Stoughton outbound/Stoughton inbound) will require a 10-15 minute walking detour around the station. This means, for example, passengers who take an inbound Providence or Stoughton train, but park on the outbound Providence side, will need an additional 10-15 minutes in the morning to access their platform via the sidewalk to the bridge at Spaulding Street.

The first phase, which repaired the Stoughton side of the pedestrian bridge, is complete.

Passengers should consider which trains they take and plan accordingly based on whether they intend to follow the detour during their morning or evening commute.
